channel.title: Typography on Hassan's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Typography on Hassan's Blog

item.title: Computer Vision
item.description: Here are some papers which every computer vision enthusiast should look into: Learning Depth with Convolutional Spatial Propagation Network (link) Stacked Hourglass Networks for Human Pose Estimation (link) Volumetric Regression Networks for 3D Human Body Reconstruction (link) Speed Estimation w/ 3D Object Detection (link) EfficientNet: Rethinking Model Scaling for Convolutional Neural Networks (link) MobileNetV2: Inverted Residuals and Linear Bottlenecks (link) OpenPose: Realtime Multi-Person 2D Pose Estimation using Part Affinity Fields (link) Dynamic Routing Between Capsules (link) Atlas: End-to-End 3D Scene Reconstruction from Posed Images (link) Other curated compilations of papers for further reading (computer vision and deep learning in general):

item.title: Hi, I'm Hassan
item.description: I am a tech entrepreneur with broad technical and business knowledge with a proven ability to take incredibly hard technical ideas and commercialize them. I have a broad expertise across many fields of emerging technology, including: Quantum Computing Artificial Intelligence Cryptography Computer Vision Using the collection of technologies under my belt, I have started many companies/initiatives to solve some of the worlds biggest problems. CryptoNumerics Iris Automation My Find Innovation Lab Pursuit Central Creative Destruction Lab

item.title: My interests.
item.description: I love learning about new things. Often times, I’ll spend hours reading about research in emerging fields of technology. Some cool things I enjoy learning about: Bayesian reasoning Intro to nootropics Here are compilations from other blogs which I found really valuable. Bill Gurley: Blogs. Eric Lefkofsky: Blogs. Marc Suster: Blogs. Naval Ravikant: Blogs. Reid Hoffman: Blogs.

item.title: My thoughts
item.description: I often reflect or think about some cool topics with a goal of learning more about myself and being able to enhance my growth. What’s recently been on my mind: Mindlessly mapping the brain Misconception about agings Also interested in any of these topics? Connect with me on Twitter.

item.title: Natural Language Processing
item.description: Here are some papers which every computer vision enthusiast should look into: Attention is all You Need (link) Adversarial Training Methods for Semi-Supervised Text Classification (link) DistilBERT, a distilled version of BERT: smaller, faster, cheaper and lighter (link) Deep contextualized word representations (link) Incorporating BERT into Neural Machine Translation (link) Unsupervised Statistical Machine Translation (link) DialogueGCN: A Graph Convolutional Neural Network for Emotion Recognition in Conversation (link) DialogueRNN: An Attentive RNN for Emotion Detection in Conversations (link)

item.title: Quantum Computing
item.description: Here are some compilations of posts from blogs which I find really valuable. Continuous-variable quantum neural networks (link) Quantum Natural Gradient (link) Transfer learning in hybrid classical-quantum neural networks (link) Variational Quantum Circuits for Deep Reinforcement Learning (link) Other curated compilations of quantum papers for further reading: Really Interesting Set of Medium Blogs on Quantum (link) More Resources on Quantum (link)

item.title: Reach Out
item.description: You can contact me on: Linkedin Twitter Email

item.title: Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Here are some papers which every computer vision enthusiast should look into: Capturing Financial markets to apply Deep Reinforcement Learning (link) A Brief Survey of Deep Reinforcement Learning (link) Deep Reinforcement Learning with Double Q-learning (link) HATS: A Hierarchical Graph Attention Network for Stock Movement Prediction (link) Other curated lists of RL papers for further reading: OpenAI Compilation (link) TopBot Compilation + Summaries (link) Robert T Blog: Papers + SUmmaries (link) Best Deep Reinforcement Learning Research of 2019 So Far (link) MC reinforcement learning paper compilations (link) Neptune AI paper compilation (link)
